area_name: Twin Towers Wall (aka Low Voltage Wall)

content.description: Route starts in dihedral with a roof then on to easier climbing until last two bolts where it gets thinner and more exposed
content.protection: 5-6 bolts, 2 bolt anchors, eye protection so angry birds don't gouge your eyes
content.location: Left side of Twin Towers crag

content.description:
This is another pretty nice moderate just right of "Batteries Not Included"   Start up a corner, then angle up and left up the slab to an overhanging finish.

From the ground it looks like there might be a big run out in the middle of the route - not the case, the bolt is just hidden.
content.location: On the right side of the main wall, just right of "Batteries Not Included".

content.description:
"Start in gully left of the roof, traverse right onto slab"

Fremont Canyon Dome Rock Guidebook by Steve Petro
Missionary man is a great line for someone breaking into the 5.10 range. A fun moderate with good flowing moves.
content.location: The location is different than the rest of the low voltage wall. It is actually on the same ledge that is halfway up Take me to the River. So if you are to descend down the gulley. about halfway down to your left you will see a ledge. Walk over and keep your eyes peeled for a bolted line.

content.description:
This is a super easy route up the left side of the wall.  A rating of 5.7 is quite generous - this route may even be a few number grades easier than that.

Pretty nice rock though, and you couldn't ask for a much prettier spot right next to the North Platte.
content.location: On the far left side of the main wall, up a reddish slab.

content.description: Wander up right side of prow past several bolts

This route is very short like most of the routes on this wall but the climbing is pretty good although polished.  Start by climbing up a flake with a finger crack which turns into a corner and a thin hands crack.
content.protection: .5 to 2 Camalots will be plenty.  There is no anchor at the top but there are some cracks to build one.  You can use the anchor on Something Wild or Distant Thunder to rap back down.
content.location: This route is located at the right end of the wall in between Something Wild and Distant Thunder.  Look for a left facing corner with a crack that starts out as a flake.

content.description:
Really nice route on great stone, my only complaint is that it should be twice as long!

Start on easy ground, gets 5.10ish towards the middle, and finishes with a thin cranker crux in the dihedral up high.

Probably only a couple of genuine 5.11 moves on this, but the position and high stone quality certainly qualify it for 3 stars.
content.protection: 5 or 6 bolts to anchors at 45 feet
content.location: The first route encountered when approaching, on the far right side of the wall.

content.description: This is an amazing line that comes out of the black roof to the right of Off Center. It is probably a V6 roof problem then links up with off center for fun, enjoyable slab climbing. The crux is definitely pulling over the lip. Fantastic climbing and a must do if in the area!
content.protection: I believe it has 5 bolts with tow bolt anchors at the top.
content.location: Dead Center can be found just to climber's right of Off Center. Very obvious black roof.

content.description:
Really nice line with a cruxy section right off the deck.  Then 5.9ish climbing to another cruxy part up high.

10a seemed about right to me, but for a shorter person, the start may be a bit tricky. If you are 5' 9" or taller, it will probably not be bad at all

pathTokens: Twin Towers Wall (aka Low Voltage Wall)
